data.title: Nice Atmosphere
data.text: Food was good, although the appetizer was better (Ravioli) than main course (Spaghetti); service was outstanding. This is a lovely, quaint restaurant in the heart of downtown Carmel.

data.title: Good food in a great Carmel location.
data.text: Good food in a great Carmel location.  A bit pricey though.  This would be more of a special occasion restaurant.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: This place is delightful and yummy! Order the shrimp pesto the staff is super friendly and this is a family owned spot in downtown Carmel

data.title: The best tiramisu!
data.text: Authentic Italian food from a family-run business in a casual setting. Service can sometimes be on the brisk side, but the food will not disappoint. Nice menu choices, good wine. We like to support local restaurants and this is one of our favorites. Don't miss the tiramisu! It's one of the best I've ever had!

data.title: Average to just above average lunch.
data.text:
Bread is fresh and I think pasta is as well. The dish was nice and the sauce wasn't too heavy. The place was almost empty though and not sure why - middle of the day for lunch. There's a place that's not too far that makes their on pasta that's great but the prices are a lot higher there.
Would eat here again if really in the mood for it-

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: Such a quaint, cute setup.   Reminds me a bit of Little Italy, NY.  I will agree that it was a bit noisy but the food was superb and the service was great.  The creamy gorgonzola  salad dressing is a must if you like gorgonzola!  Highly recommend  this place!

data.title: Pretty but noisy, expensive and bad service
data.text:
Finally ate at Donatello's which is very popular. Way too expensive for the quality of the food which is mediocre Ialian. Nice wines though. The Barbera was lovely.
Service was crazy. Started out with one server and ended up with four. They got things wrong because they didn't know the customers. They would emerge from the kitchen with a plate and a look of bewilderment as to who was getting that plate. Pretty interior but noisy.

data.title: A lunch time bargain
data.text: THe food here is always delicious.  The owner is usually on site, and other family members as well. The prices at lunch are a great value and dinner is not too pricey. Service is never fast, but always pleasant.

data.title: Great food, prices and hospitality.
data.text: No matter what we have eaten at Donatello's, it was cooked to perfection.  Service is always excellent and you can't beat the prices.  They have food on the menu that you cannot find at other restaurants.  It is a great place to meet with family, friends and business associates.  They are open for lunch and dinner.

data.title: Disappointing Italian
data.text: Food was mediocre and the Caesar Salad was very poor as the dressing had way too much mustard in it.

data.title: Always Excellent!
data.text: We are local and we love Donatello's . We go pretty regularly and love it when they have the Italian cream cake. One must is the Cheese Ravioli Appetizer. We practically lick the plate clean (ok, we really do lick the plate clean). Every dish we have tried is delicious, Seriously. So, pick something and go with it. You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Nice Downtown Restaurant
data.text: Donatello's is a cute Italian restaurant right in the middle of downtown Carmel.  It is locally owned and ran by a husband wife team.  The food is always excellent.  Service can sometimes be spotty - but if you want to be in the middle of the 'scene' but still in a quiet place - Donatello's would be a great choice.

data.title: Great food relaxing dinner
data.text: Donatello's is the go to place for my wife and I in downtown Carmel for a relaxing dinner date.  The family-owned Italian restaurant is consistently excellent and allows us to linger with no pressure to "turn the table."  Their pasta puttanesca and ravioli in Gorgonzola cream sauce are unreal, as are their Italian cream and lemon cakes.  I believe both cakes are family recipes and have taken first place at the State Fair.  Finally, Donatello's has a reasonably priced wine list, which is a rarity these days.

data.title: Delicious meal, nice ambience
data.text:
My husband and I dined at Donatello's last night.  The bottle of Chianti Riserva we started with was good right out of the bottle and reasonably priced.  We shared the antipasto platter.  It was a very generous serving of 3 meats, 3 cheeses, pickled vegetables and olives.  We each had Caesar salads.  The dressing was flavorful but the salad needed just a little more of it.  

My husband selected the Beef Rossini for his entrée.  He enjoyed it but thought the filet was a little too done for the temperature he ordered and the sauce wasn't as flavorful as the last time he enjoyed it.  I had the wild mushroom risotto.  It was so delicious!!  Risotto seems absent from many menus due the prep time required.  It was great to see it as a choice on Donatello's menu and I highly recommend it.

Not ones to shy away from dessert, coffee and after-dinner drinks we ordered all of them!  The coffee was lukewarm but had good flavor. The chocolate chip cannoli was very flavorful.  After dinner liquors were as expected and decent pours.  

The servers were attentive and friendly.  We think they should lose the white aprons and just wear black shirt and black pants.  Why?  One of the servers had a stain on her apron.  On a white apron a food stain is very obvious so we noticed it each time we saw her.  

The restaurant is very tastefully decorated. It's bustling and enjoyable to dine there. We're looking forward to our next visit.

data.title: Food  good, food slow
data.text: Food tasted great. Food delivery was very slow. They gave us our 2nd round of drinks for free to make up for it which was great but still. . .

data.title: Small space, great food!
data.text:
The ambiance at Donatello's is pretty unremarkable but the food more than makes up for it. The crusty, fresh baked bread with a balsamic and oil dip was a great start to our meal. I chose the daily special, a penne pasta with a rich homemade vodka sauce and large moist handmade meatballs, that came with a house salad. That salad had one of the best dressings I've ever tasted, a creamy gorgonzola concoction that leaves normal bleu cheese dressing in the dust. Desserts were limited compared to the normal selections at it was explained that their house baker had been ill so that was a little disappointing but the layered berries and cream parfait was sufficient but underwhelming. 

The rest of the menu is substantial and I had a hard time choosing my entree. I'll be back to give some more options a try.
